info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 9:56PM EDT until March 31 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT FOR WHITE COUNTY... At 954 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles north of Brookston, or 7 miles southwest of Monticello, moving northeast at 50 mph. In addition to the threat for a tornado, damaging winds of 60 to 70 mph are also possible, especially from Chalmers through Monticello and Idaville. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Monticello. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 185 and 198. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN <50 MPH
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
